Cassandra Harris: biography, family, education, career

Harris was born on December 15, 1948 in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia as Sandra Colleen Waites. She was the daughter of Australian parents, Roma and Walter Waites. There is no further information about her parents and siblings.

Regarding her education, at the age of 12 she attended the National Institute of Dramatic Arts under the name of Sandra Gleeson. Later, she acted in the role of the stage show ‘Boeing Boeing’, produced by Sydney. However, after that in 1961, she moved to London from Sydney.

Talking about her career, the Australian-born actress started her acting career in 1954. After playing the successful role in the stage show ‘Boeing Boeing’ from 1964 to 1965. She had appeared as ‘Cassandra’ in the American film ‘The Greek Tycoon’ ‘in 1978. Then in 1980, Sandra played the role of ‘Mrs. Lloyd Palmer’ in the film ‘Rough Cut’. After that, she was seen working as ‘Countess Lisl Von Schlaf’ in the movie ‘For Your Eyes Only’ along with her third husband Pierce Brosnan. Additionally, she has appeared in several episodes of Remington Steel as a guest star along with her husband.

Cassandra Harris: personal life, husband and death

Before passing away at the age of 43, the actress was married three times. She had her first marriage in the year 1964 with William Firth. Cassandra and Williams had spent six years together before their marriage ended in 1970. In the same year, she again found her love in a man named Dermot Harris. However, their relationship did not last long and she broke up after eight years. Although their relationship did not go well, their married life had produced two children. They are her daughter Charlotte Harris and her son Christopher Harris.

Subtitle : The late actress Cassandra Harris and Pierce Brosnan

Source : Youtube

Again, in 1980, Ama struck her way and married Irish-American actor Pierce Brosnan. After the death of her ex-husband Dermot, she adopted both children in 1986. Later, after three years of marriage, she welcomed her son Sean Brosnan.

The couple happily spent their days with their children, but in 1987, the actress was diagnosed with ovarian cancer. Due to the same illness, she lost her mother. Later, her daughter Charlotte also died of the same ovarian disease in 2013. In addition, the actress had fought the disease for four years. On December 28, 1991, she left her loved ones behind and went away from her.
